response:
Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT) is a type of cognitive-behavioral treatment that has focuses on teaching behaviors (coping skills) to:
    • control emotions and thoughts and actions
    • stop self-destructive or impulsive behavior 
    • improve relationship and communication skills

DBT includes individual, group therapy and coaching if needed. This program is the group component. It was initially developed to treat patients with borderline personality disorders but now the therapy treats other conditions, like, eating disorders, PTSD, depression, anxiety, and addiction.

pattern: What do you mean by a module?
response:
It is a group of teaching sessions focused on a specific DBT skill. 
The 4 modules are: 
    • Mindfulness
    • Interpersonal Effectiveness
    • Emotion Regulation
    • Distress Tolerance

pattern: What coping skills do you teach?
response:
The treatment pattern of Dialectical Behavior Therapy involves teaching modules:
    • Mindfulness, to improve being in the present.
    • Interpersonal Effectiveness, to improve relationships and communication
    • Emotion Regulation, to improve emotional control
    • Distress Tolerance, to stop impulsive & destructive behaviors

Many times we hear the catchall phrases, “live in the moment”, “the past is gone”, and “don’t worry about the future”. Being mindful is applying those concepts in our daily lives without judgement. This skill is practiced in every group session.

pattern: What do you mean by distress tolerance?
response: It’s the ability to self-regulate their behavior in a crisis. It helps individuals avoid self-destruction as a coping mechanism for problematic situations. It also teaches the difference between accepting reality and justifying it or their destructive actions.

pattern: What do you mean by Interpersonal Effectiveness?
What is the Interpersonal Effectiveness module about?
response: It teaches the person how to be assertive and to create and maintain healthy short- or long-term professional or romantic relationships and friendships. It teaches the person how to be assertive and to create and maintain healthy short- or long-term professional or romantic relationships and friendships.

pattern: What do you mean by Emotional Regulation
response: People with personality and mood disorders have difficulty managing their emotions. They are unable to navigate feelings easily. When exposed to specific situations, they may not be able to control intense reactions. Through DBT skills, people learn emotion regulation by identifying conditions, overcoming obstacles, increasing positive thought processes, and applying logical actions to their emotional thoughts.

pattern: How long has the program been running?
response: We have been running the program for 1 year already here at the The Insight Clinic. However, this is a standard well researched treatment program that has been used successfully since the 1970s.

The instructors are Georgia Fullerton, Expressive Arts Therapist and Fatima Tahir, Master of Social Work. Both with extensive experience in group therapy and in DBT skills training,
